decks.notes: The deck revolves around generating a large number of creature tokens using Prossh's ability and various ramp spells, while also utilizing sacrifice outlets like Goblin Bombardment and Ashnod's Altar to trigger abilities such as Zulaport Cutthroat and Purphoros, God of the Forge for direct damage. The deck includes a variety of tutors and card draw spells to find key combo pieces such as Tooth and Nail for instant board presence. Additionally, there is a strong emphasis on mana ramp to quickly cast high-cost creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End and Craterhoof Behemoth to overwhelm opponents. Overall, the deck aims to assemble powerful combinations quickly to outpace and defeat opponents in a 1v1 format.

The main focus of this deck is to ramp up quickly with mana dorks and land ramp spells, while utilizing Selvala's ability to draw cards and generate more mana. The deck aims to assemble a powerful combo, possibly involving Selvala herself along with cards like Umbral Mantle and Staff of Domination to create infinite mana and draw the deck to find a win condition. Other combo pieces like Wirewood Symbiote and Temur Sabertooth can also be utilized for infinite mana loops. The deck also includes powerful creatures and spells like Craterhoof Behemoth and Genesis Wave to overwhelm the opponent once the combo is assembled.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures led by the commander, Arahbo, Roar of the World. The deck includes a variety of low-cost creatures with abilities that boost each other, making them even more powerful when Arahbo is on the battlefield. The deck also includes support cards like equipment, removal spells, and protection spells to ensure the creatures can deal damage effectively and survive against opponents' strategies. By maintaining a fast-paced and aggressive strategy, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early in the game and maintain that advantage to secure a victory in a one-on-one duel.

The main strategy of this deck is to ramp up quickly with mana dorks and land ramp spells, leading to the ability to play big threats like Craterhoof Behemoth and Avenger of Zendikar. Titania, Protector of Argoth's ability to create Elemental tokens when lands go to the graveyard synergizes well with cards like Crucible of Worlds and Wasteland. The deck also includes cards like Sylvan Safekeeper and Hall of Gemstone to protect key pieces and disrupt opponents' strategies. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a strong board presence and finish them off with powerful creatures and overrun effects like Triumph of the Hordes.

The main focus of this deck is to play aggressively with Zurgo Bellstriker as the commander, using a wide range of direct damage spells and fast creatures to quickly reduce the opponent's life total to zero. The deck includes a variety of burn spells such as Lightning Bolt, Thunderous Wrath, and Searing Blaze to deal damage to the opponent or their creatures. Creatures like Spark Elemental, Goblin Rabblemaster, and Monastery Swiftspear provide additional sources of damage and pressure. With a low mana curve and a focus on dealing damage as quickly as possible, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and win the game through speed and aggression.

This deck focuses on aggressive play, utilizing Zurgo Bellstriker as the commander to lead the charge. The main strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with a barrage of direct damage spells and hasty creatures, dealing damage quickly and efficiently. The deck includes a wide variety of burn spells like Lightning Bolt, Rift Bolt, and Lava Spike, along with creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear to keep up the pressure. By maintaining a fast pace and constantly attacking the opponent's life total, the goal is to win the game before the opponent can stabilize. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to be proactive, aggressive, and unrelenting in its assault on the opponent.

The main concept of this deck is to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy using a combination of removal spells, hand disruption, and versatile planeswalkers. The deck aims to establish dominance by leveraging Queen Marchesa's abilities to draw cards and create tokens while also providing a steady flow of threats through various planeswalkers and high-impact creatures like Wurmcoil Engine and Emrakul, the Promised End. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's three-color requirements and provide flexibility in casting spells at different points in the game. Overall, the deck excels at maintaining control of the battlefield and out-valuing opponents through efficient removal and powerful threats.

The deck focuses on controlling the opponent's board by utilizing various spells and abilities to disrupt their game plan. It includes a mix of burn spells, counterspells, and removal to deal with threats efficiently. The commander, Kess, Dissident Mage, allows for the reuse of spells from the graveyard, providing additional value and flexibility in controlling the game. The deck also includes card draw and filtering spells to ensure consistency in drawing into the necessary pieces. With a mix of proactive and reactive spells, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent while maintaining control of the board state. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements and ensure smooth gameplay.
